title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.2 SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: Output 4.2 Strengthened national capacity to support the implementation of the National Social Protection Policy framework through contextualised interventions in urban areas and along the humanitarian-development continuum, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2025 child sensitive evidence and analysis informs more effective and efficient planning, budgeting and implementation of programmes for reducing child deprivation, inequities and gender inequalities, especially for the most vulnerable and marginalised children and adolescents

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Expanding and improving cash transfers for children
Policy and strategy development and coordination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.2 Strengthened national capacity to support the implementation of the National Social Protection Policy framework throughcontextualised interventions in urban areas and along the humanitarian-development continuum

description.narrative: UNICEF together with other development partners continue to support the government to build a ;coordinated, inclusive, and gender-sensitive social protection system that will protect children and;the most vulnerable groups from the adverse poverty that was made worse by the COVID-19 pandemic. UNICEF is implementing two child-sensitive programmes on social protection (i) The urban Social Protection Programme for Adolescent Girls in Kampala and the Child Sensitive Social Protection Programme in West Nile with a focus on health systems strengthening | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2022

title.narrative: Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide , Text

baseline.value: Level 2 - Social protection coordination mechanism is established and functioning at the central level only with a clear mandate, responsibilities and operating modalities

target.value: 2025:Level 3 - Social protection coordination mechanism is established and functioning at both central and local levels with clear mandates, responsibilities and operating modalities

actual.value: 2021:Level 2 - Social protection coordination mechanism is established and functioning at the central level only with a clear mandate, responsibilities and operating modalities
